private_information: I can only manipulate blocks whose labels are vowels. The vowels present in this problem are A, E, I.
I can only pick the block that is currently at the top of a stack.
I may move only one block at a time.
I cannot place a block except either on top of another block or on the table.
vowel_agent.goal: Contribute to rearranging the blocks so the final single stack has M on the table and, from bottom to top, M L K J I H G F E D C B A.

private_information: I can only manipulate blocks whose labels are consonants. The consonants present in this problem are B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L, M.
I can only pick the block that is currently at the top of a stack.
I may move only one block at a time.
I cannot place a block except either on top of another block or on the table.
consonant_agent.goal: Contribute to rearranging the blocks so the final single stack has M on the table and, from bottom to top, M L K J I H G F E D C B A.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and must produce a final planning representation in PDDL compatible with the FastDownwards solver.
I must keep the actions belonging to each agent distinct so the planner can model which agent can perform which actions.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agents' capabilities and the initial configuration and produce a PDDL domain and problem that achieve the global final stack arrangement.

public_information: There are multiple stacks of uniquely labeled blocks on a table. Blocks are labeled with single uppercase letters.
Agents may only interact with blocks that are currently at the top of a stack.
Agents may move at most one block at a time. Moves are pick and place actions where a block is picked from the top of a stack or the table and placed either on top of another block or on the table.
The global objective is to transform the initial stacking configuration into a single stack with M on the table and, from bottom to top, M L K J I H G F E D C B A.

knowledge.system_prompt: You are an agent that can manipulate vowel-labeled blocks. Produce a concise structured description of your capabilities and which vowel blocks you can move in the current initial configuration. Do not produce PDDL. Focus on capability descriptions, the list of vowel blocks you can manipulate, which of those are currently top blocks, and any movement constraints you require the orchestrator to know.
knowledge.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. You have the following private information: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. The environment public information is: {environment->public_information}. The initial stacks are: {environment->init->stacks}. Provide a structured capability statement and a list of vowel blocks you can move based on the current top-of-stack positions. Output should be suitable for consumption by an orchestrator that will build the final PDDL representation.

knowledge.system_prompt: You are an agent that can manipulate consonant-labeled blocks. Produce a concise structured description of your capabilities and which consonant blocks you can move in the current initial configuration. Do not produce PDDL. Focus on capability descriptions, the list of consonant blocks you can manipulate, which of those are currently top blocks, and any movement constraints you require the orchestrator to know.
knowledge.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. You have the following private information: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. The environment public information is: {environment->public_information}. The initial stacks are: {environment->init->stacks}. Provide a structured capability statement and a list of consonant blocks you can move based on the current top-of-stack positions. Output should be suitable for consumption by an orchestrator that will build the final PDDL representation.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert at producing PDDL domain and problem files for the FastDownwards planner. You must produce a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem that model two agent types with distinct action capabilities. The domain must include typed move actions or predicates that restrict which agent type can move which block classes, and it must enforce that only top blocks can be moved and that moves place a block on either another block or the table. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target FastDownwards compatibility.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the following pieces of information and produce a final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that achieve the global goal. The global goal is: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Use the initial stacks: {environment->init->stacks}. Use the agents' capability descriptions provided in the inputs. The first input is the vowel agent description: {vowel_knowledge}. The second input is the consonant agent description: {consonant_knowledge}. Keep actions distinct for the two agent types so the planner can assign moves to the agent that is allowed to perform them. Ensure the domain models top-of-stack constraints and single-block moves. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The produced PDDL should be ready to run with FastDownwards.
